name: Limbo of the Lost
overview: The premise of LIMBO OF THE LOST is loosely based on the merchant vessel mystery of the Mary Celeste. "Limbo of the Lost" in its own right is the name of a mythical quadrant of the Sargasso Sea, alternatively known as the Bermuda Triangle. On the 5th December, 1872 the Mary Celeste was found mysteriously deserted in the Atlantic Ocean, off the coast of the Azores Islands, Portugal. Scheduled for release on the A1200 and CD32 in 1995 by Rasputin, the game wasn't released at the time despite previews appearing in Amiga magazines and the release of a CD32 demo, it was reworked and finally released in full in 2007.
